intro: Ardisia omissa, commonly known as the slender arrowwood, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, clustered white flowers that appear in the summer. Following flowering, it produces bright red berries that are attractive to birds. Ardisia omissa is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and adaptability to various soil conditions.
